Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Draughts \Draughts\, n. pl. A game, now more commonly called {checkers}. See {Checkers}. [1913 Webster]
Note: {Polish draughts} is sometimes played with 40 pieces on a board divided into 100 squares. --Am. Cyc. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Checkers \Check"ers\ (ch[e^]k"[~e]rz), n. pl. [See {Checher}, v.] A game, called also {draughts}, played on a checkerboard by two persons, each having twelve men (counters or checkers) which are moved diagonally. The game is ended when either of the players has lost all his men, or can not move them. [1913 Webster]
checkers n : a checkerboard game for two players who each have 12 pieces; the object is to jump over and so capture the opponent's pieces [syn: {draughts}]
